data.question: What is the chemical formula for ROD-6?
What type of SBU does ROD-6 contain?
What is the maximum thermal stability temperature of ROD-6?
What is the CO2 uptake capacity of ROD-6 at 1 atm and 298 K?
Does ROD-6 exhibit higher CO2 uptake under ambient conditions compared to ROD-7?
Is the CO2/N2 selectivity of ROD-6 constant upon loading?
What is the underlying net of ROD-6?
What is the main difference in the coordination environment between MnII in ROD-6 and InIII in ROD-7?
data.answer: In ROD-6, MnII is coordinated to two H2O besides the carboxyl-O, while in ROD-7, InIII is coordinated with hydroxyl groups.

data.question: Is ROD-6 resistant to hydrolysis at room temperature?
Does ROD-6 have a higher thermal stability than most MOFs?
What is the BET surface area of ROD-6?
Does ROD-6 have strongly interacting sites for CO2 adsorption?
What is the isosteric heat of adsorption range for CO2 in ROD-6?
Does the CO2/N2 selectivity for ROD-6 increase with the increment of the CO2 ratio in the gas mixture?
What is the formula for ROD-7?
What is the underlying net of ROD-7?
Is the CO2/N2 selectivity of ROD-7 almost ineffective when the ratio of the CO2:N2 mixture is larger than 0.5?
What is the CO2 uptake capacity of ROD-7 at 1 atm and 298 K?
Does ROD-6 have a higher thermal stability than ROD-7?
What is the main structural difference between ROD-6 and ROD-7?
data.answer: ROD-6 contains MnII ions coordinated to H2O, while ROD-7 contains InIII ions coordinated with hydroxyl groups.
